decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Narset, Parter of Veils, along with efficient removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. Stoneforge Mystic is used to tutor for powerful equipment such as Batterskull and Umezawa's Jitte, which can help gain advantages in combat. True-Name Nemesis provides a difficult-to-answer threat, while counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce help protect your own spells and disrupt opponent's plays. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's mana base and lock them out of the game using disruptive artifacts like Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, and Ensnaring Bridge. The aggressive creatures like Goblin Rabblemaster and Legion Warboss provide pressure on the opponent while planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Karn, the Great Creator offer versatile threats and utility. The deck aims to capitalize on its disruptive elements to slow down the opponent and secure victory through a combination of creature damage and powerful spells like Fiery Confluence.

This deck focuses on quickly disrupting the opponent with powerful non-basic land hate cards like Blood Moon and Magus of the Moon, while also utilizing mana accelerants like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide to play threats such as Legion Warboss and Chandra, Torch of Defiance early on. The Karn planeswalkers provide additional utility and card advantage, while cards like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void further disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to lock down the opponent's resources while quickly overwhelming them with aggressive creatures.

The focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting, then bring them back into play using spells like Reanimate and Exhume. By utilizing combo pieces like Griselbrand and Chancellor of the Annex, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and win the game in a decisive manner. The inclusion of disruption spells like Cabal Therapy and Unmask helps protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Trinisphere while quickly deploying aggressive threats like Legion Warboss and Goblin Rabblemaster. It also utilizes artifacts like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator to further disrupt the opponent and gain advantage. The deck's fast pace and disruptive elements make it well-suited for shutting down the opponent's strategy and overwhelming them with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on assembling a fast and aggressive board presence through a synergy of Human creatures that benefit from each other's abilities. By utilizing mana acceleration with Noble Hierarch and Aether Vial, this deck aims to quickly deploy threats like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Thalia's Lieutenant to disrupt the opponent's game plan while growing its own board. The inclusion of disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter further hinders the opponent's strategy, allowing the deck to maintain control of the battlefield and pressure the opponent's life total.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources through card advantage and disruption, using cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Thoughtseize. It also includes versatile removal spells like Fatal Push and Kolaghan's Command. The deck plays a mix of powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Wrenn and Six for value generation. It aims to lock opponents out of the game with Leovold, Emissary of Trest and other disruptive creatures while generating card advantage with cards like Brainstorm and Snapcaster Mage. The mana base is optimized for color fixing and efficiency.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Crop Rotation and Sylvan Scrying to quickly find and assemble the Dark Depths-Thespian's Stage combo, allowing you to create a 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token in one turn. The deck also includes disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Duress to protect your combo, as well as removal like Abrupt Decay to deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of cards like Elvish Reclaimer and Sylvan Safekeeper provide additional utility and protection, making the deck a powerful and resilient combo deck in the Legacy format.

The main focus of this Reanimator combo deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Chancellor of the Annex using cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting, and then bring them back into play using spells like Animate Dead and Reanimate. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, explosive plays and high-powered creatures, ultimately leading to a quick victory through reanimation and comboing off before the opponent has a chance to react effectively.

The deck focuses on quickly getting powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. It also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce to protect the combo pieces. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with massive creatures early in the game, putting pressure on them to find a way to deal with the threats before it's too late. The strategy revolves around cheating big creatures into play while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells.

The deck focuses on generating early aggression and disruption by utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, True-Name Nemesis, Gurmag Angler, and Dreadhorde Arcanist. It also includes disruptive spells like Stifle, Force of Will, and Daze to control the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the board and pressure the opponent quickly, capitalizing on tempo advantage from disruptive plays. The mana base is built to support the aggressive game plan with fetch lands and dual lands, allowing for consistent access to all colors of mana.

The deck aims to control the opponent's board through a combination of counterspells and removal spells, while also utilizing the Stoneforge Mystic package to find powerful equipment such as Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice to generate advantage. True-Name Nemesis provides a must-answer threat, while Weathered Wayfarer helps fix mana and find important lands like Karakas. Aether Vial allows for efficient deployment of creatures, while cards like Tomik, Distinguished Advokist and Fblthp, the Lost provide additional utility and disruption. Overall, the deck focuses on establishing board control and leveraging powerful equipment to close out the game.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents while establishing a strong board presence. By using cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Stoneforge Mystic to control the board, combined with disruptive lands like Wasteland and Rishadan Port, this deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while using Aether Vial to cheat out creatures and equipment. The deck also includes various hatebears like Phyrexian Revoker and Sanctum Prelate to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, this deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent while limiting their resources.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive Sliver creatures quickly while controlling the opponent's board with counterspells and removal spells. By using Aether Vial to quickly put Slivers onto the battlefield and Standstill to slow down the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of powerful creatures. The inclusion of Cavern of Souls ensures that the Slivers are uncounterable, while also providing mana fixing. With a mix of evasion, protection, and aggression, the deck looks to close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this Combo - Dredge deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with dredge cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Grave-Troll, enabling you to bring back creatures like Narcomoeba and Bridge from Below for powerful combos. By using cards like Cabal Therapy and Breakthrough to discard cards and Cephalid Coliseum to draw extra cards, you can consistently fuel your graveyard and overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of creatures. The deck relies on synergy between cards and graveyard manipulation to create an explosive win condition.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponents with disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Phyrexian Revoker while also utilizing powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice to quickly close out games. The deck also has efficient removal like Swords to Plowshares and a mana denial strategy with cards like Rishadan Port and Wasteland. By combining aggressive creatures with disruptive elements, the deck aims to control the game and outpace opponents in order to secure a victory.
